question.text: Unidirectional transmission of a nerve impulse through nerve fibre is due to the fact that

options.text: Nerve fibre is insulated by a medullary sheath
Sodium pump starts operating only at the cyton and then continues into the nerve fibre
Neurotransmitters are released by dendrites and not by axon endings
Neurotransmitters are released by the axon endings and not by dendrites

solution.text: Transmission of nerve impulses through nerve fibre occurs unidirectionally because axon of one neuron linked to the dendrite of another neuron through the synapse. Synaptic vesicles are filled with a neurotransmitter (<math><mi>e.</mi><mi>g</mi><mo>.</mo><mo>,</mo></math> acetylcholine) released by axon endings, not by dendrites.
